intro: Pilea barahonensis, commonly known as the Barahon shield plant, is a species of flowering plant native to the island of Hispaniola. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes nettle plants, and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and somewhat elusive species.
